fields.name: Badrinath
fields.description: One of the four sacred Char Dham pilgrimage sites dedicated to Lord Vishnu
fields.mythology: According to Hindu mythology, Lord Vishnu meditated here under a Badri tree

fields.name: Kedarnath
fields.description: Sacred temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, one of the twelve Jyotirlingas
fields.mythology: Legend says the Pandavas built this temple to seek Lord Shiva's forgiveness

fields.name: Gangotri
fields.description: Source of the holy river Ganga, sacred to Hindus
fields.mythology: King Bhagirath meditated here to bring Ganga to earth

fields.name: Yamunotri
fields.description: Source of the Yamuna river, dedicated to Goddess Yamuna
fields.mythology: Sage Asit Muni resided here and bathed daily in both Ganga and Yamuna

fields.title: Use Reusable Water Bottles
fields.description: Carry reusable water bottles to reduce plastic waste during your pilgrimage

fields.title: Biodegradable Toiletries
fields.description: Use biodegradable soaps and shampoos to protect mountain water sources

fields.title: Stay on Marked Trails
fields.description: Stick to marked trails to protect vegetation and prevent erosion

fields.title: Support Local Homestays
fields.description: Choose local homestays and businesses to support the community

fields.title: Pack Out All Trash
fields.description: Follow Leave No Trace principles - pack out everything you bring in

fields.name: Ramesh Kumar
fields.contact_info: Available at local market near temple
fields.description: Traditional wood carver specializing in religious sculptures and temple decorations

fields.name: Sunita Devi
fields.description: Expert weaver creating traditional Garhwali shawls and blankets using local wool

fields.name: Mohan Singh
fields.description: Master stone carver creating religious idols and architectural elements
